content: You’re probably a piano guy. On a guitar there are like three different ways to make the same C sharp seven sound.
Keyboard shortcuts are…even less like musical instruments than like typing text…
…what does that have to do with anything…
…huh?
But are they?

You’re expecting me to defend the straw-man proposition that keyboard shortcuts should be unaffected by CapsLock because pianos rule and guitars drool?

No. Keyboard shortcuts should be unaffected by CapsLock because it’s what users expect.

Haha yeah I agree caps lock shouldn’t matter. And my previous comment meant to illustrate that the case of the letter should not be taken into account, only the keys that are displayed as constituting the shortcut.
It is actually a deeply philosophical question.
Is holding down the caps lock key just a lazy way to hit the shift key in advance?
If only Plato was still around
No, it’s not, because Caps Lock only affects the way letters are typed, and again keyboard shortcuts are not typing.
If you need a lazy way to hit the Shift key in advance, you turn on Sticky Keys.
But philosophy isn’t the point. If shortcuts in other apps were affected by Caps Lock, I’d be arguing for that. UI is all about expectations and consistency.
But isn’t caps lock the original sticky key?

What difference would it make if I answered “yes”, “no”, or “well actually [insert historical discussion involving mechanical typewriters and 6-bit vs. 7-bit ASCII and whatever else we might want to throw in and maybe also guitars]”?
Is the tab key four spaces or eight?
Sure we can throw Tab onto the pile too. Why not?
Coke or Pepsi?
(Is this Steve’s Saturday troll show)
I thought it was Wednesday. Somebody send me a calendar.
We’re still working on that widget I think.
Haha. That’s my excuse!
Truth be told I somehow actually do realize today is Saturday. Which is a miracle given the circumstances.
Sunday too in some places, of course.
Haha my days have all melded together into, “today”.
Exactly

Even though it’s the root of all evil, and pretty much caused the situation we are all in right now on this Wednesday.
You know that stupid Touch Bar on MacBooks made me remap caps lock to escape.
The horror...
Haha
Before you die: remap caps lock to escape, spend extra time with your loved ones, listen to side one of the Velvet Underground.
In that order.
Lol
Love me some Lou Reed.
I guess this is where keyboard help ends up... appropriate I guess.
Here is where I admit that I listened to it a couple times and was like “meh”. Early Led Zep would have been more sincere.
I can appreciate that.
#music
It was a well constructed joke imho that got it slightly wrong on the details. Three part jokes. Almost too formulaic.

Logical && search operator?
Yep. If only.
Is it && or ||?
union. but with a more user friendly word.

Is it && or ||?

Yes.

Also, I'm not serious about supporting this with our current search operators, but maybe you remember that idea we were trying but dismissed as very niche earlier: custom filters.

Say, we allow you to give us a test function that, for each message returns true or false, and then use that to filter all the messages the frontend has. That has the advantage of us not having to implement a new syntax, and a parser etc.
Yeah. I think with enough imagination we can build these so-called advanced features in a mostly approachable UI.
It sounds like something that could open/be initiated from the "search_open search_icon", it currently does nothing.
